productDocument.title: Ionic Yahoo Messenger 1
productDocument.headline: Yahoo Messenger template
productDocument.introduction:
[Yahoo messenger](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/yahoo-messenger-chat-share/id1054013981?mt=8) surprisingly came back on the internet but unfortunately didn't get a very warm welcome. Yahoo seems to keep updating their app with some interesting features so let's see what they can do. Love the UI though. 

I always take it serious to keep the code quality high, with clean and self-explained code. When purchasing this, you also get my latest "helper" snippets inside the package to make it more fun to code.
productDocument.changelog:
*Last updated: Jun 17 2017*

### v1

* First version

### v2

* Compatible with Ionic CLI 3.4.0
productDocument.screens:
1. Contact list
2. Contact Search
3.  New conversation
4. Messaging
5. Settings
productDocument.notes:
If you want to integrate this plugin into your project, don't forget these dependencies

1. Material colors `$ bower install material-colors --save`
2. Modify the default color theme to match Yahoo's color in `/scss/ionic.app.scss`

```
// line 18
$calm:                            #33c1d7 !default;
```

template.title: Ionic Market v1
template.description: - Old document template where we still use Bower
template.body:
## Introduction

<%= data.introduction %>

## What's in the package
- **Ionic Project source code**: based on the folder structure generated with `Ionic CLI`
- **No Backend code**: this is just the UI, not a fully functional app. Data is mostly static dummy unless mentioned, e.g GIF search uses the real Giphy API

## Preview

<% if (data.apkUrl) { %>
**Download APK to preview the theme:** 

[![enter image description here](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/MIkXV-iIhrxPG5tZn8QTglczrISwLwebr8QmCKcJFN6NL0eNLf5GqWltrefAZwzAwh2r4RPk=w96-h96-e365)
<%= data.slug %>_demo.apk](<%= data.apkUrl %>)
<% } %>

**Watch on Youtube**

See how it works on Youtube: <%= data.youtubeUrl %>
<% if (data.youtubeUrl) { %>
<%= data.youtubeEmbedUrl %>
<% } else { %>
(coming soon)
<% } %>

Happy prototyping!

<% if (data.trackingUrl) { %>
![enter image description here](<%= data.trackingUrl %>)
<% } %>

## Changelog

> Note: All updates are on <%= data.framework %>

<%= data.changelog %>

## Screens

<%= data.screens %>

## Run locally

1.Install Ionic environment

```
$ npm install -g cordova@9.0.0
$ npm install -g ionic@4.12.0
```

2.After purchasing, download the zip file containing the entire demo app and unzip

3.Go inside the extracted folder

4.Install all dependencies 

```
$ npm install
$ bower install
```

5.Start local server

```
$ ionic serve
```

6.Your default browser should now automatically open the template


## Notes

<%= data.notes %>

## Contact
If you need any technical support or have any questions, don't hesitate to send me a message: [mr_hie@yahoo.com](mailto:mr_hie@yahoo.com)

Homepage: [https://www.takethatdesign.com](https://www.takethatdesign.com)
